attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table provides the ground-truth details for any anomalies detected in the audit report generation process. When the trend chart shows a spike, use this table for root-cause analysis to satisfy CCI-000169 requirements.

**How to Use:** Filter this table by time to match the anomaly period from the trend chart. Sort by `anomaly_score` to prioritize the most severe deviations. Examine the `influencers.host.name`, `influencers.user.name`, and `influencers.process.name` fields to determine the source of the unusual report generation activity and verify if it was authorized.
attributes.title: [AU-12, CCI-000169] ML - Detailed Report Generation Anomalies
attributes.visState: {"title":"[AU-12, CCI-000169] ML - Detailed Report Generation Anomalies","type":"table","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"max","params":{"field":"anomaly_score","customLabel":"Max Anomaly Score"},"schema":"metric"},{"id":"2","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"@timestamp","orderBy":"_key","order":"desc","size":10,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"},{"id":"3","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"influencers.host.name","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":5,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"},{"id":"4","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"influencers.user.name","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":5,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"},{"id":"5","enabled":true,"type":"terms","params":{"field":"influencers.process.name","orderBy":"1","order":"desc","size":5,"otherBucket":false,"otherBucketLabel":"Other","missingBucket":false,"missingBucketLabel":"Missing","includeIsRegex":true,"excludeIsRegex":true},"schema":"bucket"}],"params":{"perPage":10,"showPartialRows":false,"showMetricsAtAllLevels":false,"sort":{"columnIndex":null,"direction":null},"showTotal":false,"totalFunc":"sum","showToolbar":true,"percentageCol":"","autoFitRowToContent":false}}

attributes.description:
This table provides a detailed list of all audit reports that have been generated. It is the primary tool for verifying that the required reports are being created for each component.

**Why and when this visualization is best used:**
This table is most effective when you need to see the specifics of each generated report. Use it to confirm the existence of reports, check their creation times, and identify the responsible user and process. It's the go-to visualization for a detailed, evidence-based compliance check.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Filter the table by 'host.name' to focus on a specific system. You can also sort by '@timestamp' to see the most recent reports. The 'user.name' and 'process.name' fields will help you identify who or what is generating the reports. The 'file.path' will show you where the report is stored. By examining this data, you can confirm that each component is meeting its audit reporting requirements.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"(process.name: (*report* OR *audit*) AND file.extension: (pdf OR csv OR txt OR xlsx)) OR (event.action: (report_generated OR audit_review_completed))"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CCI-000169] Generated Audit Reports

attributes.description:
This bar chart shows the number of audit reports generated by each user. It helps to quickly identify which users are responsible for report generation and to spot any potential anomalies.

**Why and when this visualization is best used:**
Use this chart to get a quick overview of report generation activity across different users. It is particularly useful for identifying users who are generating an unusually high or low number of reports, which could indicate a misconfiguration, a policy violation, or a security issue.

**How an analyst can use it:**
The height of each bar represents the number of reports generated by that user. Hover over a bar to see the exact count. If a user who is not authorized to generate reports appears in the chart, or if an authorized user has a count of zero, it warrants further investigation. Use this chart as a starting point to identify potential issues, then use the detailed table to dig deeper.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"(process.name: (*report* OR *audit*) AND file.extension: (pdf OR csv OR txt OR xlsx)) OR (event.action: (report_generated OR audit_review_completed))"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CCI-000169] Audit Reports Generated by User

attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status of audit report generation for CCI-000169 based on the anomaly scores from the associated ML job. A high score indicates a significant deviation from the normal rate of report generation.
attributes.title: [CCI-000169] Audit Generation ML

attributes.description:
This heatmap shows which systems (hosts) are generating key types of audit events. It provides a quick, visual confirmation of audit coverage across your architecture, directly supporting CCI-000169 (Audit Record Generation).

**Why and When:** Use this visualization to get a high-level overview of your audit posture. It's most valuable for quickly identifying blind spots. For instance, if a critical server is not reporting any 'authentication' or 'file' events, it signifies a major gap in audit generation that needs immediate attention.

**How to Use:** Each cell represents the volume of a specific event action generated by a particular host. Darker cells indicate higher event counts. Look for rows (hosts) that are entirely light-colored or have unexpectedly light cells for critical actions. This suggests that the host is either offline, misconfigured, or not generating the required audit trails. Use the global filters to narrow down to a specific group of assets to check their collective coverage.
attributes.title: [AU-12] Audit Event Generation Matrix by Host

attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-000169, which requires the organization to provide a report of audit review, analysis, and reporting to designated personnel. These visualizations will help you track the generation of these reports and ensure they are delivered to the correct individuals. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, use the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard to filter by 'host.name' or other relevant fields. This will allow you to verify that each component is generating the required audit reports.
attributes.title: [CCI-000169] Audit Generation
attributes.visState: {"aggs":[],"params":{"fontSize":12,"markdown":"# [CCI-000169] Audit Generation\n\n### The organization provides a report of audit review, analysis, and reporting to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].","openLinksInNewTab":false},"title":"[CCI-000169] Audit Generation","type":"markdown"}
